We are looking for an Amazing: Front end developer

Seniority: Mid (3-5 years)

Type of position: Hybrid model in Braga. Candidates need to be already living in Portugal!

The amazing you, will have:

  • 3+ years of frontend development experience with ReactJS, Next.js, and Redux.
  • Proficiency in Node.js and experience integrating WebSocket or Server-Sent Events (SSE) into frontend workflows.
  • Solid understanding of component-based architecture and proven experience building and maintaining reusable UI components.
  • Strong experience with Server-Driven UI (SDUI) design patterns and rendering dynamic UI from backend-driven schemas.
  • Familiarity with chat prompt design patterns and conversational UI paradigms (e.g., AI assistant responses, user input formats, inline feedback).
  • Understanding of accessibility standards and responsive design.
  • Experience working in Agile development environments with tools like Jira, Git, and CI/CD workflows.
  • Fluent in English and Portuguese.



Why should you become part of our family?

  • You can develop a career that fits you: your career development is personalized, taking in consideration your needs and goals from a short to long term
  • Interesting Challenges Ahead: you can work for several clients from different sectors of activity
  • Free training programs: Our training and certification programs in languages, tech, behavior and business will help you to reach your full potential faster
  • International projects in Benelux: you can gain international experience in Benelux and balance a new way of living with work
  • Type of projects (depending on the project you might find one of this types of projects):
    • In hybrid Systems: Is important to balance work with socialization, that¬¥s why a hybrid system works for us and for you
    • Full Remote projects: If you want to work while you enjoy the comfort of your home
    • Full Onsite projects: if you prefere the company of your colleagues!

  • Take care of your well-being: Enjoy our free nutrition, psicologist, general medicine appointments and our yoga and personal training days‚Ä¶ all remote


Who are we?

Founded in 2008 and based in Lisbon, KCS IT is a consulting company in the field of Information Technology and Services, focused on creating value for our clients through three main areas: Consulting, Outsourcing, Inovation and Training. Our commitment to talent development is unmistakable in the recent opening of the Porto, Leiria and Azores hubs, which aims to develop technology for the national and international market. Since 2018 we have been elected one of the 10 major companies in the ‚ÄúIndex of Excellence‚Äù, an initiative that aims to reward organizations that invest most in the development and satisfaction of their employees.

At KCS IT we defend equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for all employees!

We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability or any factor other than merit.

All applications with skills for the role are welcome!

Title: Junior AI/ML Engineer
Description:
Lensa is a career site that helps job seekers find great jobs in the US. We are not a staffing firm or agency. Lensa does not hire directly for these jobs, but promotes jobs on LinkedIn on behalf of its direct clients, recruitment ad agencies, and marketing partners. Lensa partners with DirectEmployers to promote this job for Motion Recruitment. Clicking "Apply Now" or "Read more" on Lensa redirects you to the job board/employer site. Any information collected there is subject to their terms and privacy notice.

Junior AI/ML Engineer

Remote Only

Contract

$45/hr - $70/hr

TG Federal is seeking a Junior AI/ML Engineer to support a Federal Health Client.

In this role you will be responsible for designing intelligent solutions using cutting-edge tools like Azure OpenAI (GPT models), Azure Functions, Cosmos DB, and WebApps. As a Junior AI/ML Engineer, you'll work alongside experienced developers and data scientists to create web and API-based applications that integrate natural language processing, cloud services, and modern web technologies.

Responsibilities


Assist in the design, development, and deployment of AI-driven solutions using Azure cloud services
Collaborate with the engineering team on integrating GPT models into web applications and APIs
Support the creation and testing of rapid prototypes for internal and client-facing use cases
Write clean, efficient code primarily in Python and/or JavaScript
Learn and adapt quickly to evolving tools, frameworks, and technologies
Contribute to documentation, testing, and iterative improvement of AI features


Must-Have Qualifications


Six months to one year of experience with GPT models or other large language models (LLMs)
Six months to one year of experience with Python or JavaScript in academic or personal projects
Knowledge of AI/ML concepts, including neural networks, NLP, or model training
Possession of strong problem-solving skills
Possession of excellent written and verbal communication skills
Bachelor's Degree


Nice-to-Have Qualifications


Experience with Microsoft Azure or other cloud platforms
Experience with Azure OpenAI, Azure Functions, or Cosmos DB
Experience with front-end technologies (e.g., HTML, CSS, React)
Knowledge of REST APIs and cloud-based app architecture


You Will Receive The Following Benefits


Medical Insurance - Four medical plans to choose from for you and your family
Dental & Orthodontia Benefits
Vision Benefits
Health Savings Account (HSA)
Health and Dependent Care Flexible Spending Accounts
Voluntary Life Insurance, Long-Term & Short-Term Disability Insurance
Hospital Indemnity Insurance
401(k) including match with pre and post-tax options
Paid Sick Time Leave
Legal and Identity Protection Plans
Pre-tax Commuter Benefit
529 College Saver Plan


TG Federal is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All applicants must be currently authorized to work on a full-time basis in the country for which they are applying, and no sponsorship is currently available. Employment is subject to the successful completion of a pre-employment screening. Accommodation will be provided in all parts of the hiring process as required under MRP's Employment Accommodation policy. Applicants need to make their needs known in advance.

If you have questions about this posting, please contact support@lensa.com

Title: AI/ML Engineer
Description:
About Air Apps

At Air Apps, we believe in thinking bigger‚Äîand moving faster. We‚Äôre a family-founded company on a mission to create the world‚Äôs first AI-powered Personal & Entrepreneurial Resource Planner (PRP), and we need your passion and ambition to help us change how people plan, work, and live. Born in Lisbon, Portugal in 2018‚Äîand now with offices in both Lisbon and San Francisco‚Äîwe‚Äôve remained self-funded while reaching over 100 million downloads worldwide.

Our long-term focus drives us to challenge the status quo every day, pushing the boundaries of AI-driven solutions that truly make a difference. Here, you‚Äôll be a creative force, shaping products that empower people across the globe.

Join us on this journey to redefine resource management‚Äîand change lives along the way.

The Role

As an AI/ML Engineer, you will play a crucial role in designing, developing, and optimizing machine learning models to power our mobile applications. You will work closely with product managers, engineers, and designers to create intelligent, data-driven features that enhance user experiences. Your expertise in artificial intelligence and deep learning will help us innovate and stay ahead in the mobile app industry.

Please note that this post serves the purpose of enhancing our talent pool while we prepare to launch the official job. As soon as it gets posted we will get in touch with you.

Responsibilities


Develop, train, and optimize machine learning models for various mobile app features.
Research and implement state-of-the-art AI techniques to improve user engagement and app performance.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate AI-driven solutions into our applications.
Design and maintain scalable ML pipelines, ensuring efficient model deployment and monitoring.
Analyze large datasets to derive insights and drive data-driven decision-making.
Stay updated with the latest AI trends and best practices, incorporating them into our development processes.
Optimize AI models for mobile environments to ensure high performance and low latency.


Requirements


Around 3+ years of experience in AI/ML development, preferably in mobile applications.
Proficiency in Python, TensorFlow, PyTorch, or other ML frameworks.
Experience with deep learning, NLP, computer vision, and statistical modeling.
Familiarity with cloud-based ML services (AWS, Google Cloud, or Azure).
Strong understanding of data structures, algorithms, and software engineering best practices.
Experience in deploying and maintaining ML models in production.
Ability to work collaboratively in a remote team environment.
Strong problem-solving skills and a passion for innovation.


What benefits do we offer?


Apple hardware ecosystem for work.
Annual Bonus.
Medical Insurance (including vision & dental).
Disability insurance - short and long-term.
401k up to 4% contribution.
Air Stipend $3,120/year, paid over 12 monthly installments (for home office, learning, wellness, etc.).
Air Conference ‚Äì an opportunity to meet the team, collaborate, and grow together.


Diversity & Inclusion

At Air Apps, we are committed to fostering a diverse, inclusive, and equitable workplace. We enthusiastically welcome applicants from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We celebrate diversity in all its forms and believe that varied voices and experiences make us stronger.

Application Disclaimer

At Air Apps, we value transparency and integrity in our hiring process. Applicants must submit their own work without any AI-generated assistance. Any use of AI in application materials, assessments, or interviews will result in disqualification.

Title: Junior Data Scientist
Description:
Verified Job On Employer Career Site




Job Summary:

Two Sigma is a financial sciences company that combines data analysis, invention, and rigorous inquiry to address complex challenges in investment management. The Data Scientist will engage in independent research, develop methodologies, and collaborate with engineers and stakeholders to extract insights from data.




Responsibilities:

‚Ä¢ Independently research and develop hypotheses based on diverse and unique real-world datasets.

‚Ä¢ Conduct literature reviews to develop and apply cutting-edge methodologies for extracting meaningful signals from our vast data holdings.

‚Ä¢ Partner with our engineers and business stakeholders to rigorously explore and test your theories.

‚Ä¢ All the while, you‚Äôll remain engaged in the academic community. As examples, you can:

‚Ä¢ Join our reading circles to stay up to date on the latest research papers in your fields

‚Ä¢ Attend academic seminars to learn from thought leaders from top universities




Qualifications:




Required:

‚Ä¢ 1-5+ years of experience in applied data analysis & prediction, preferably in an industry setting

‚Ä¢ Degree in a technical or quantitative disciplines, like statistics, mathematics, physics, electrical engineering, or computer science

‚Ä¢ Proficient in Python and SQL

‚Ä¢ Performed an in-depth research project, examining real-world data

‚Ä¢ Are an independent thinker who can creatively approach data analysis and communicate complex ideas clearly




Preferred:

‚Ä¢ Background in finance




Company:

Two Sigma's technology-driven team streamlines the use of machine learning, distributed computing and research to guide its endeavors. Founded in 2001, the company is headquartered in New York, New York, USA, with a team of 1001-5000 employees. The company is currently Late Stage. Two Sigma has a track record of offering H1B sponsorships.

Title: Data Scientist (Junior) OBIQUA (Data Scientist 1)
Description:
Lensa is a career site that helps job seekers find great jobs in the US. We are not a staffing firm or agency. Lensa does not hire directly for these jobs, but promotes jobs on LinkedIn on behalf of its direct clients, recruitment ad agencies, and marketing partners. Lensa partners with DirectEmployers to promote this job for Huntington Ingalls Industries. Clicking "Apply Now" or "Read more" on Lensa redirects you to the job board/employer site. Any information collected there is subject to their terms and privacy notice.

Requisition Number: 24519

Required Travel: 0 - 10%

Employment Type: Full Time/Salaried/Exempt

Anticipated Salary Range: $70,199.00 - $100,285.00

Security Clearance: TS/SCI with Poly

Level of Experience: Mid HI

This opportunity resides with All-Domain Operations (ADO), a business group within HII's Mission Technologies division. All-Domain Operations comprises multi-domain operations, platforms and logistics, and intelligence operations.

HII designs, develops, integrates and manages the sensors, systems and other assets necessary to support integrated ISR operations and accelerated decision-making. With data fusion and mission management capabilities for the Department of Defense, the combatant commands and the intelligence community, HII advances the mission around the globe.

Meet HII's Mission Technologies Division

Our team of more than 7,000 professionals worldwide delivers all-domain expertise and advanced technologies in service of mission partners across the globe. Mission Technologies is leading the next evolution of national defense - the data evolution - by accelerating a breadth of national security solutions for government and commercial customers. Our capabilities range from C5ISR, AI and Big Data, cyber operations and synthetic training environments to fleet sustainment, environmental remediation and the largest family of unmanned underwater vehicles in every class. Find the role that's right for you. Apply today. We look forward to meeting you.

To learn more about Mission Technologies, click here for a short video: https://vimeo.com/732533072

Summary

Are you a Data Scientist ready to be at the forefront of intelligence innovation? HII-Mission Technologies is seeking passionate individuals to join our team in partnership with the Defense Intelligence Agency (DIA) under the Object Based Intelligence and Quality Assurance (OBIQUA) task order. This is a unique opportunity to contribute to the Foundational Military Intelligence (FMI) analysis and production, driving new capabilities and insights that will revolutionize intelligence analysis.

You'll be instrumental in delivering cutting-edge Artificial Intelligence (AI), Machine Learning (ML), and advanced analytics capabilities, enhancing the intelligence prowess of the U.S. and its allies. Your work will directly support the unification and operationalization of AI across the Defense Intelligence Enterprise, facilitating Joint All-Domain Operations (JADO) by enabling rapid decision-making and seamless information sharing, ultimately providing crucial warfighting advantages.

If you're eager to contribute to a growing team that's shaping the future of defense intelligence, apply today! The primary place of performance will be at DIA Facilities across the National Capital Region (NCR), including Reston, VA, Washington D.C. and Bethesda, MD. This position is contingent upon the OBIQUA Contract Award.

What you will do

We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Data Scientist to drive advanced analytical initiatives. In this role, you will:


Lead data analysis and AI/ML development: Conduct comprehensive data analysis, including exploratory, predictive, and statistical analysis, to generate actionable insights and inform decision-making. Design, develop, and implement advanced AI/ML tools and algorithms, such as recommendation engines and automated scoring systems, to optimize processes and enhance capabilities.
Innovate and apply cutting-edge techniques: Propose and apply advanced statistical and mathematical techniques. Design and evaluate leading-edge algorithmic intelligence concepts, leveraging novel technologies like large language models (LLMs), natural language processing (NLP), and machine learning to automate and enhance analytical processes and knowledge modeling.
Ensure responsible AI and data governance: Evaluate data science, AI, and advanced analytic methods for risks, biases, and limitations. Provide guidance on AI system development, testing, and deployment, ensuring compliance with tradecraft standards and best practices for responsible AI, including bias detection and prompt fairness testing.
Collaborate and refine analytical solutions: Partner with team members to develop and refine exploratory efforts, optimize data queries across various protocols (e.g., GraphQL, SPARQL, SQL), and enhance semantic data retrieval and reasoning across knowledge graphs.
Conduct research and provide expertise: Continuously research state-of-the-art methods in data analysis, AI, and machine learning. Serve as a primary point of contact for data science expertise, advising on emerging methods, tools, and algorithms to advance analytical capabilities.
Develop and evaluate system performance: Design and execute testing, evaluation, and verification/validation (TEVV) protocols to assess system performance, robustness, and fairness. Develop and track performance metrics, analyze results, and collaborate on corrective actions and continuous improvements.
Manage and scale data solutions: Work with ambiguous information, deconstruct complex questions, and develop data schemas. Create and work in distributed analytic environments, scaling algorithms for large and complex datasets.
Support capability development: Contribute to, edit, and store code in government-owned/controlled source version control repositories.
Additional duties as assigned or required


What we are looking for


0 years relevant experience with Bachelors in related field; High School Diploma or equivalent and 4 years relevant experience
Clearance: Must possess and maintain a TS/SCI with a current Poly
Skilled in data visualization and use of graphical applications, including Microsoft Office (Power BI-) and Tableau; major data science languages, such as R and Python; managing and merging of disparate data sources, preferably through R, Python, or SQL; statistical analysis; and data mining algorithms.
Prior experience with large data multi¬¨ INT analytics, ML, and automated predictive analytics.
In-depth knowledge and experience in using data analytics, data engineering, data mining, exploratory analysis, predictive analysis, and statistical analysis, and scientific techniques to correlate data into graphical, written, visual and verbal narrative products, enabling more informed analytic decisions
Experience writing either R or Python scripts to drive data science workflows, have experience using SQL, and managing and merging of disparate data sources, preferably through R, Python, or SQL; statistical analysis; and data mining algorithms.
Experience with large data, spatial data, Multi-INT analytics, ML, and automated predictive analytics.


Bonus points for...


Bachelors with 3 years of experience
Recent applicable experience within the last 2 years
Possesses a professional or graduate certificate in data science from a university, major online learning platform (all business for Data Scientists at any experience level


Physical Requirements

May require working in an office, industrial, shipboard, or laboratory environment. Capable of climbing ladders and tolerating confined spaces and extreme temperature variances.

HII is more than a job - it's an opportunity to build a new future. We offer competitive benefits such as best-in-class medical, dental and vision plan choices; wellness resources; employee assistance programs; Savings Plan Options (401(k)); financial planning tools, life insurance; employee discounts; paid holidays and paid time off; tuition reimbursement; as well as early childhood and post-secondary education scholarships. Bonus/other non-recurrent compensation is occasionally offered for qualified positions, and if applicable to this role will be addressed by the recruiter at the screening phase of application.

Why HII

We build the world's most powerful, survivable naval ships and defense technology solutions that safeguard our seas, sky, land, space and cyber. Our workforce includes skilled tradespeople; artificial intelligence, machine learning (AI/ML) experts; engineers; technologists; scientists; logistics experts; and business administration professionals.

Recognized as one of America's top large company employers, we are a values and ethics driven organization that puts people's safety and well-being first. Regardless of your role or where you serve, at HII, you'll find a supportive and welcoming environment, competitive benefits, and valuable educational and training programs for continual career growth at every stage of your career.

Together we are working to ensure a future where everyone can be free and thrive.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, physical or mental disability, age, or veteran status or any other basis protected by federal, state, or local law.

Do You Need Assistance?

If you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the employment process, please send an e-mail to buildyourcareer@hii-co.com and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information. Reasonable accommodations are considered on a case-by-case basis. Please note that only those inquiries concerning a request for reasonable accommodation will be responded to from this email address. Additionally, you may also call 1-844-849-8463 for assistance. Press #3 for HII Mission Technologies.

If you have questions about this posting, please contact support@lensa.com

  • Support capability development: Contribute to, edit, and store code in government-owned/controlled source version control repositories.
  • Additional duties as assigned or required

What we are looking for

  • 0 years relevant experience with Bachelors in related field; High School Diploma or equivalent and 4 years relevant experience
  • Clearance: Must possess and maintain a TS/SCI with a current Poly
  • Skilled in data visualization and use of graphical applications, including Microsoft Office (Power BI-) and Tableau; major data science languages, such as R and Python; managing and merging of disparate data sources, preferably through R, Python, or SQL; statistical analysis; and data mining algorithms.
  • Prior experience with large data multi¬¨ INT analytics, ML, and automated predictive analytics.
  • In-depth knowledge and experience in using data analytics, data engineering, data mining, exploratory analysis, predictive analysis, and statistical analysis, and scientific techniques to correlate data into graphical, written, visual and verbal narrative products, enabling more informed analytic decisions
  • Experience writing either R or Python scripts to drive data science workflows, have experience using SQL, and managing and merging of disparate data sources, preferably through R, Python, or SQL; statistical analysis; and data mining algorithms.
  • Experience with large data, spatial data, Multi-INT analytics, ML, and automated predictive analytics.

Bonus points for...

  • Bachelors with 3 years of experience
  • Recent applicable experience within the last 2 years
  • Possesses a professional or graduate certificate in data science from a university, major online learning platform (all business for Data Scientists at any experience level

Physical Requirements

May require working in an office, industrial, shipboard, or laboratory environment. Capable of climbing ladders and tolerating confined spaces and extreme temperature variances.

HII is more than a job - it's an opportunity to build a new future. We offer competitive benefits such as best-in-class medical, dental and vision plan choices; wellness resources; employee assistance programs; Savings Plan Options (401(k)); financial planning tools, life insurance; employee discounts; paid holidays and paid time off; tuition reimbursement; as well as early childhood and post-secondary education scholarships. Bonus/other non-recurrent compensation is occasionally offered for qualified positions, and if applicable to this role will be addressed by the recruiter at the screening phase of application.

Why HII

We build the world's most powerful, survivable naval ships and defense technology solutions that safeguard our seas, sky, land, space and cyber. Our workforce includes skilled tradespeople; artificial intelligence, machine learning (AI/ML) experts; engineers; technologists; scientists; logistics experts; and business administration professionals.

Recognized as one of America's top large company employers, we are a values and ethics driven organization that puts people's safety and well-being first. Regardless of your role or where you serve, at HII, you'll find a supportive and welcoming environment, competitive benefits, and valuable educational and training programs for continual career growth at every stage of your career.

Together we are working to ensure a future where everyone can be free and thrive.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, physical or mental disability, age, or veteran status or any other basis protected by federal, state, or local law.

Do You Need Assistance?

If you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the employment process, please send an e-mail to buildyourcareer@hii-co.com and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information. Reasonable accommodations are considered on a case-by-case basis. Please note that only those inquiries concerning a request for reasonable accommodation will be responded to from this email address. Additionally, you may also call 1-844-849-8463 for assistance. Press #3 for HII Mission Technologies.

If you have questions about this posting, please contact support@lensa.com

Title: Junior Data Scientist
Description:
Verified Job On Employer Career Site




Job Summary:

The Voleon Group is a technology company specializing in AI and machine learning applications in finance. As a Data Scientist, you will harvest insights from complex data, focusing on data curation, analysis, visualization, and communication of findings to enhance data-driven investment initiatives.




Responsibilities:

‚Ä¢ Design and implement systems to ensure data correctness and monitor data health in data stores and live feeds

‚Ä¢ Proactively identify abnormal production behavior and communicate them clearly to relevant stakeholders

‚Ä¢ Perform extemporaneous analyses on research and production trading systems with leadership

‚Ä¢ Harness financial expertise and statistical analysis to gain actionable insights into our production trading and research systems

‚Ä¢ Design and implement analysis pipelines that automate those analyses found to be valuable for ongoing monitoring




Qualifications:




Required:

‚Ä¢ 1+ years of applied end-to-end industry experience, including internships working with complex datasets, including curation, querying, aggregation, exploratory data analysis, and visualization

‚Ä¢ Experience using statistical methods to analyze data, identify patterns, conduct root cause analysis, discover insights, and recommend solutions

‚Ä¢ Ability to frame and answer questions mathematically

‚Ä¢ Ability to infer useful forward-looking directions from results of retrospective analysis

‚Ä¢ Fluency in managing, processing, and visualizing tabular data using a combination of SQL, Pandas, and R

‚Ä¢ Basic software development skills and experience with bash, linux/unix, and git

‚Ä¢ Ability to refine requirements from ambiguous requests to produce reports demonstrating excellence in communication

‚Ä¢ Bachelor‚Äôs degree in a quantitative discipline (statistics, biostatistics, data science, computer science, or a related field)




Preferred:

‚Ä¢ Master‚Äôs degree in a quantitative discipline

‚Ä¢ Prior industry experience or displayed interest in finance, such as related academic projects, coursework in financial engineering, or industry internships

‚Ä¢ Experience developing in a production-facing environment and familiarity with standard concepts and tooling, e.g., CI/CD, git, Airflow




Company:

The Voleon Group is a family of companies committed to the development & deployment of cutting-edge technologies in investment management. Founded in 2008, the company is headquartered in Berkeley, California, USA, with a team of 201-500 employees. The company is currently Growth Stage. The Voleon Group has a track record of offering H1B sponsorships.

Title: Data Scientist/Python/ML/All Levels/Chicago, New Grad
Description:
Verified Job On Employer Career Site




Job Summary:

Motion Recruitment delivers IT Talent Solutions for Contract, Direct Hire, Managed Solutions and Statement of Work to all of North America from our 21 delivery centers. A growing fintech company headquartered in downtown Chicago is hiring a full-time data scientist to join their collaborative and high-performing data science team, where you will work across the full lifecycle of modeling with meaningful ownership and mentorship.




Responsibilities:

‚Ä¢ 80% Hands-On Modeling, Feature Engineering, and Analysis

‚Ä¢ 0% Management Duties (Individual Contributor Role

‚Ä¢ 20% Team Collaboration & Cross-Functional Sync




Qualifications:




Required:

‚Ä¢ Strong foundation in Mathematics or Statistics

‚Ä¢ Experience with linear and nonlinear modeling technique

‚Ä¢ Proficiency in Python (pandas, NumPy, scikit-learn)

‚Ä¢ SQL knowledge, preferably with PostgreSQL

‚Ä¢ Familiarity with Jupyter notebooks and version control tools (Git/GitHub)

‚Ä¢ Comfortable with container tools like Docker

‚Ä¢ Ability to communicate technical concepts clearly and concisely

‚Ä¢ Strong time management and multitasking abilities

‚Ä¢ Experience working in a fast-paced environment or similar industry settings




Preferred:

‚Ä¢ Experience using cloud-based data science tools such as AWS SageMaker

‚Ä¢ Exposure to deploying models in production environment

‚Ä¢ Industry experience in fintech, tech, or analytic

‚Ä¢ Ability to work independently and proactively identify data opportunities

‚Ä¢ Ethical approach to data usage and model decisioning




Company:

Motion Recruitment delivers IT Talent Solutions for Contract, Direct Hire, Managed Solutions and Statement of Work to all of North America from our 21 delivery centers. Founded in 1989, the company is headquartered in Boston, Massachusetts, USA, with a team of 501-1000 employees. The company is currently Late Stage.

Title: Junior Data Scientist ‚Äì Transaction Intelligence
Description:
Verified Job On Employer Career Site




Job Summary:

Capital One is a diversified banking company that offers early and later stage venture, and debt financing investments. As a Data Scientist at Capital One, you‚Äôll be part of a team that‚Äôs leading the next wave of disruption at a whole new scale, using the latest in computing and machine learning technologies to unlock opportunities for customers.




Responsibilities:

‚Ä¢ Partner with a cross-functional team of data scientists, software engineers, and product managers to deliver a product customers love

‚Ä¢ Leverage a broad stack of technologies ‚Äî Python, Conda, AWS, Spark, Databricks, Snowflake, and more ‚Äî to reveal the insights hidden within huge volumes of numeric and textual data

‚Ä¢ Build machine learning models through all phases of development, from design through training, evaluation, validation, and implementation

‚Ä¢ Flex your interpersonal skills to translate the complexity of your work into tangible business goals

‚Ä¢ Explore and apply the latest advances in machine learning, such as transformer modeling architectures, to real-world problems facing the financial services industry.




Qualifications:




Required:

‚Ä¢ Currently has, or is in the process of obtaining one of the following with an expectation that the required degree will be obtained on or before the scheduled start date: A Bachelor's Degree in a quantitative field (Statistics, Economics, Operations Research, Analytics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related quantitative field) plus 5 years of experience performing data analytics

‚Ä¢ A Master's Degree in a quantitative field (Statistics, Economics, Operations Research, Analytics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related quantitative field) or an MBA with a quantitative concentration plus 3 years of experience performing data analytics

‚Ä¢ A PhD in a quantitative field (Statistics, Economics, Operations Research, Analytics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related quantitative field)




Preferred:

‚Ä¢ Master‚Äôs Degree in ‚ÄúSTEM‚Äù field (Science, Technology, Engineering, or Mathematics) plus 3 years of experience in data analytics, or PhD in ‚ÄúSTEM‚Äù field (Science, Technology, Engineering, or Mathematics)

‚Ä¢ At least 1 year of experience working with AWS

‚Ä¢ At least 3 years‚Äô experience in Python, Scala, or R

‚Ä¢ At least 3 years‚Äô experience with machine learning

‚Ä¢ At least 3 years‚Äô experience with SQL




Company:

Capital One is a diversified banking company that offers early and later stage venture, and debt financing investments. Founded in 1994, the company is headquartered in Mclean, Virginia, USA, with a team of 10001+ employees. The company is currently Public Company. Capital One has a track record of offering H1B sponsorships.

Title: AI Consultant
Description:
We are looking for an AI consultant to join our innovative team, driving transformative AI solutions for our clients. The ideal candidate will excel in collaborating with clients to identify business challenges, design custom AI applications, and deploy enterprise-grade solutions in cloud environments. This role requires deep technical expertise, strong problem-solving skills, and a passion for leveraging cutting-edge AI technologies to deliver measurable business impact.

Job Duties & Responsibilities


Client Collaboration: Partner with clients to uncover operational pain points and business challenges through in-depth consultations, workshops, and stakeholder engagement, ensuring alignment with strategic goals.
Requirements Analysis: Capture and document detailed business requirements, translating them into precise technical specifications for custom AI applications tailored to client needs.
AI Solution Design: Architect and implement innovative AI solutions, leveraging frameworks like LangChain and LangGraph to create scalable, efficient, and impactful systems.
Cloud Deployment: Build, test, and deploy enterprise-grade AI solutions in cloud environments (AWS, Azure, GCP), ensuring high availability, security, and performance.
Agentic AI Development: Design and develop AI agents with decision-making capabilities, integrating LLMs with external tools and data sources for dynamic, context-aware workflows.
Code Management: Maintain and manage robust GitHub repositories, ensuring best practices in version control, code collaboration, and documentation for team and client projects.
Performance Optimization: Continuously evaluate and optimize AI models and systems for accuracy, efficiency, and scalability, incorporating client feedback and evolving requirements.
Cross-Functional Collaboration: Work closely with data scientists, engineers, and product teams to integrate AI solutions into broader technology ecosystems, ensuring seamless functionality.
Knowledge Sharing: Mentor junior team members and contribute to internal knowledge bases, fostering a culture of innovation and technical excellence.


Required Experience


Experience: 5+ years in Technology Design and Development roles
Advanced proficiency in Python and JavaScript for building and scripting AI applications.
Hands-on experience with Agentic AI and Large Language Models (LLMs), including fine-tuning, prompt engineering, and integration with external tools.
Expertise in GitHub repository management, including branching strategies, pull requests, and collaborative code reviews.
Experience building custom AI systems using LangChain, LangGraph, or similar frameworks
Strong experience with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, or GCP), including services like AWS SageMaker, Azure AI, or Google Vertex AI for AI model deployment.
Interpersonal communication skills with the ability to work independently or as part of team with both the Business and technology staff.
Proven experience identifying business process improvements addressable through AI
Strong understanding of AI governance, ethics, regulatory compliance, and security protocols


Preferred Skills


Previous experience working in Higher Education or the public sector with State-, County-, and City-level institutions


Education


Bachelor's degree required. Degree in Business Administration, Finance, Computer Science or related field.
Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer, AI
Description:
Machine Learning Engineer (MLE), Artificial Intelligence

Join us as we pursue our disruptive new vision to make machine data accessible, usable and valuable to everyone. We are a company filled with people who are passionate about our product and seek to deliver the best experience for our customers. At Splunk, we‚Äôre committed to our work, customers, having fun and most importantly to each other‚Äôs success. Learn more about Splunk careers and how you can become a part of our journey!

Role

As a Machine Learning Engineer in the Artificial Intelligence group, you will be responsible for developing the core AI/ML capabilities to power the entire Splunk product portfolio and help our customers to drive their journey to digital resiliency. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams, mentor junior team members, and help drive the engineering roadmap of the area.

Responsibilities

The responsibilities of this role include


Development of the AI/ML platform and infrastructure that drives our product‚Äôs key ML use cases in the cybersecurity and observability domains.
Collaborate closely with software engineers, applied scientists, and product managers to integrate generative AI solutions into our products and services.
Stay up to date with the latest developments in the field of AI/ML, and ensure that these advancements are properly incorporated into our technology roadmap.
Actively participate in cross-functional discussions and strategic decisions related to AI directions and product roadmaps.


Requirements

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities


Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field with at least 3+ years of industry experience.
Experience with containerization and orchestration tools (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes).
Experience with model deployment and serving into production environments
Knowledge of version control systems, especially Git.
Knowledge of CI/CD principles and tools.
Familiarity with cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure) and serverless architecture.
Experience with MLOps platforms such as MLflow or Kubeflow.
Previous experience working in cross-functional teams and collaborating with data scientists and DevOps teams.
Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to troubleshoot complex issues.
Excellent communication skills with the ability to articulate complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences.


Annual Base Pay $176,600 - $225,900 USD

When available, the salary range posted for this position reflects the projected hiring range for new hire, full-time salaries in U.S. and/or Canada locations, not including equity or benefits. For non-sales roles the hiring ranges reflect base salary only; employees are also eligible to receive annual bonuses. Hiring ranges for sales positions include base and incentive compensation target. Individual pay is determined by the candidate's hiring location and additional factors, including but not limited to skillset, experience, and relevant education, certifications, or training. Applicants may not be eligible for the full salary range based on their U.S. or Canada hiring location. The recruiter can share more details about compensation for the role in your location during the hiring process.

U.S. employees have access to quality medical, dental and vision insurance, a 401(k) plan with a Cisco matching contribution, short and long-term disability coverage, basic life insurance and numerous wellbeing offerings.

Employees receive up to twelve paid holidays per calendar year, which includes one floating holiday (for non-exempt employees), plus a day off for their birthday. Non-Exempt new hires accrue up to 16 days of vacation time off each year, at a rate of 4.92 hours per pay period. Exempt new hires participate in Cisco‚Äôs flexible Vacation Time Off policy, which does not place a defined limit on how much vacation time eligible employees may use but is subject to availability and some business limitations. All new hires are eligible for Sick Time Off subject to Cisco‚Äôs Sick Time Off Policy and will have eighty (80) hours of sick time off provided on their hire date and on January 1st of each year thereafter. Up to 80 hours of unused sick time will be carried forward from one calendar year to the next such that the maximum number of sick time hours an employee may have available is 160 hours. Employees in Illinois have a unique time off program designed specifically with local requirements in mind. All employees also have access to paid time away to deal with critical or emergency issues. We offer additional paid time to volunteer and give back to the community.

Employees on sales plans earn performance-based incentive pay on top of their base salary, which is split between quota and non-quota components. For quota-based incentive pay, Cisco typically pays as follows


75% of incentive target for each 1% of revenue attainment up to 50% of quota;


1.5% of incentive target for each 1% of attainment between 50% and 75%;

1% of incentive target for each 1% of attainment between 75% and 100%; and once performance exceeds 100% attainment, incentive rates are at or above 1% for each 1% of attainment with no cap on incentive compensation.

For non-quota-based sales performance elements such as strategic sales objectives, Cisco may pay up to 125% of target. Cisco sales plans do not have a minimum threshold of performance for sales incentive compensation to be paid.

Splunk, a Cisco company, is an Equal Opportunity Employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, genetic information, age, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected basis.

  • 75% of incentive target for each 1% of revenue attainment up to 50% of quota;

1.5% of incentive target for each 1% of attainment between 50% and 75%;

1% of incentive target for each 1% of attainment between 75% and 100%; and once performance exceeds 100% attainment, incentive rates are at or above 1% for each 1% of attainment with no cap on incentive compensation.

For non-quota-based sales performance elements such as strategic sales objectives, Cisco may pay up to 125% of target. Cisco sales plans do not have a minimum threshold of performance for sales incentive compensation to be paid.

Splunk, a Cisco company, is an Equal Opportunity Employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, genetic information, age, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected basis.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer, AI
Description:
Machine Learning Engineer (MLE), Artificial Intelligence

Join us as we pursue our disruptive new vision to make machine data accessible, usable and valuable to everyone. We are a company filled with people who are passionate about our product and seek to deliver the best experience for our customers. At Splunk, we‚Äôre committed to our work, customers, having fun and most importantly to each other‚Äôs success. Learn more about Splunk careers and how you can become a part of our journey!

Role

As a Machine Learning Engineer in the Artificial Intelligence group, you will be responsible for developing the core AI/ML capabilities to power the entire Splunk product portfolio and help our customers to drive their journey to digital resiliency. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams, mentor junior team members, and help drive the engineering roadmap of the area.

Responsibilities

The responsibilities of this role include


Development of the AI/ML platform and infrastructure that drives our product‚Äôs key ML use cases in the cybersecurity and observability domains.
Collaborate closely with software engineers, applied scientists, and product managers to integrate generative AI solutions into our products and services.
Stay up to date with the latest developments in the field of AI/ML, and ensure that these advancements are properly incorporated into our technology roadmap.
Actively participate in cross-functional discussions and strategic decisions related to AI directions and product roadmaps.


Requirements

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities


Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field with at least 3+ years of industry experience.
Experience with containerization and orchestration tools (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes).
Experience with model deployment and serving into production environments
Knowledge of version control systems, especially Git.
Knowledge of CI/CD principles and tools.
Familiarity with cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure) and serverless architecture.
Experience with MLOps platforms such as MLflow or Kubeflow.
Previous experience working in cross-functional teams and collaborating with data scientists and DevOps teams.
Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to troubleshoot complex issues.
Excellent communication skills with the ability to articulate complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences.


Annual Base Pay $176,600 - $225,900 USD

When available, the salary range posted for this position reflects the projected hiring range for new hire, full-time salaries in U.S. and/or Canada locations, not including equity or benefits. For non-sales roles the hiring ranges reflect base salary only; employees are also eligible to receive annual bonuses. Hiring ranges for sales positions include base and incentive compensation target. Individual pay is determined by the candidate's hiring location and additional factors, including but not limited to skillset, experience, and relevant education, certifications, or training. Applicants may not be eligible for the full salary range based on their U.S. or Canada hiring location. The recruiter can share more details about compensation for the role in your location during the hiring process.

U.S. employees have access to quality medical, dental and vision insurance, a 401(k) plan with a Cisco matching contribution, short and long-term disability coverage, basic life insurance and numerous wellbeing offerings.

Employees receive up to twelve paid holidays per calendar year, which includes one floating holiday (for non-exempt employees), plus a day off for their birthday. Non-Exempt new hires accrue up to 16 days of vacation time off each year, at a rate of 4.92 hours per pay period. Exempt new hires participate in Cisco‚Äôs flexible Vacation Time Off policy, which does not place a defined limit on how much vacation time eligible employees may use but is subject to availability and some business limitations. All new hires are eligible for Sick Time Off subject to Cisco‚Äôs Sick Time Off Policy and will have eighty (80) hours of sick time off provided on their hire date and on January 1st of each year thereafter. Up to 80 hours of unused sick time will be carried forward from one calendar year to the next such that the maximum number of sick time hours an employee may have available is 160 hours. Employees in Illinois have a unique time off program designed specifically with local requirements in mind. All employees also have access to paid time away to deal with critical or emergency issues. We offer additional paid time to volunteer and give back to the community.

Employees on sales plans earn performance-based incentive pay on top of their base salary, which is split between quota and non-quota components. For quota-based incentive pay, Cisco typically pays as follows


75% of incentive target for each 1% of revenue attainment up to 50% of quota;


1.5% of incentive target for each 1% of attainment between 50% and 75%;

1% of incentive target for each 1% of attainment between 75% and 100%; and once performance exceeds 100% attainment, incentive rates are at or above 1% for each 1% of attainment with no cap on incentive compensation.

For non-quota-based sales performance elements such as strategic sales objectives, Cisco may pay up to 125% of target. Cisco sales plans do not have a minimum threshold of performance for sales incentive compensation to be paid.

Splunk, a Cisco company, is an Equal Opportunity Employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, genetic information, age, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected basis.

Title: Computer Scientist (Junior) OBIQUA (Data Scientist 1)
Description:
Lensa is a career site that helps job seekers find great jobs in the US. We are not a staffing firm or agency. Lensa does not hire directly for these jobs, but promotes jobs on LinkedIn on behalf of its direct clients, recruitment ad agencies, and marketing partners. Lensa partners with DirectEmployers to promote this job for Huntington Ingalls Industries. Clicking "Apply Now" or "Read more" on Lensa redirects you to the job board/employer site. Any information collected there is subject to their terms and privacy notice.

Requisition Number: 24549

Required Travel: 0 - 10%

Employment Type: Full Time/Salaried/Exempt

Anticipated Salary Range: $70,199.00 - $100,285.00

Security Clearance: TS/SCI with Poly

Level of Experience: Entry Level HI

This opportunity resides with All-Domain Operations (ADO), a business group within HII‚Äôs Mission Technologies division. All-Domain Operations comprises multi-domain operations, platforms and logistics, and intelligence operations.

HII designs, develops, integrates and manages the sensors, systems and other assets necessary to support integrated ISR operations and accelerated decision-making. With data fusion and mission management capabilities for the Department of Defense, the combatant commands and the intelligence community, HII advances the mission around the globe.

Meet HII‚Äôs Mission Technologies Division

Our team of more than 7,000 professionals worldwide delivers all-domain expertise and advanced technologies in service of mission partners across the globe. Mission Technologies is leading the next evolution of national defense ‚Äì the data evolution - by accelerating a breadth of national security solutions for government and commercial customers. Our capabilities range from C5ISR, AI and Big Data, cyber operations and synthetic training environments to fleet sustainment, environmental remediation and the largest family of unmanned underwater vehicles in every class. Find the role that‚Äôs right for you. Apply today. We look forward to meeting you.

To learn more about Mission Technologies, click here for a short video: https://vimeo.com/732533072

Summary

Are you a Computer Scientist ready to be at the forefront of intelligence innovation? HII-Mission Technologies is seeking passionate individuals to join our team in partnership with the Defense Intelligence Agency (DIA) under the Object Based Intelligence and Quality Assurance (OBIQUA) task order. This is a unique opportunity to contribute to the Foundational Military Intelligence (FMI) analysis and production, driving new capabilities and insights that will revolutionize intelligence analysis.

You'll be instrumental in delivering cutting-edge Artificial Intelligence (AI), Machine Learning (ML), and advanced analytics capabilities, enhancing the intelligence prowess of the U.S. and its allies. Your work will directly support the unification and operationalization of AI across the Defense Intelligence Enterprise, facilitating Joint All-Domain Operations (JADO) by enabling rapid decision-making and seamless information sharing, ultimately providing crucial warfighting advantages.

If you're eager to contribute to a growing team that's shaping the future of defense intelligence, apply today! The primary place of performance will be at DIA Facilities across the National Capital Region (NCR), including Reston, VA, Washington D.C. and Bethesda, MD. This position is contingent upon the OBIQUA Contract Award.

What you will do


Employ computer science principles, including artificial intelligence, machine learning, network science, probability modeling, data mining, data engineering, data warehousing, data compression, and data protection, to design and develop automated or computer-assisted prototypes and software. You'll work to derive insights and correlate complex findings into clear graphical, written, and verbal narratives for intelligence analysis.
Develop and utilize machine learning and data mining algorithms, including those based on open-source capabilities (like MIMOSA prediction algorithms). You'll integrate these code algorithms to support government intelligence search and discovery missions, making best practice recommendations for data management within hardware, software, storage, and bandwidth constraints.
Apply data science techniques to support predictive analysis, social media and crowdsourced data analytics, wargaming, and strategy development. You'll also leverage exploratory analysis and rapid iteration techniques on large volumes of data to quickly derive intelligence and automate data exploitation processes.
: Review and evaluate OBI documentation from data and advanced analytics (AA) owners, ensuring compliance with tradecraft standards and best practices for system development and deployment. You'll assess documentation for completeness and accuracy, providing detailed feedback, and assist in maintaining an OBI documentation repository.
Collaborate on identifying and implementing practices for responsible AI development, covering areas like bias detection, hallucination recognition, prompt fairness testing, and adherence to analytic tradecraft standards and security policies. You'll also provide consultation on OBI governance and knowledge modeling.
Partner on developing and refining semantic data retrieval and reasoning across knowledge graphs by optimizing data queries using multiple protocols (e.g., GraphQL, SPARQL, SHACL, SQL).
Collaborate on exploratory efforts using novel technologies (e.g., Large Language Models, Natural Language Processing, Machine Learning) to automate ontologies for semantic accuracy and interoperability, and to support/automate entity recognition, extraction, and summarization in line with analytic tradecraft standards.
Design and execute TEVV protocols to evaluate the performance, robustness, and fairness of AI systems in all-source analysis contexts. You'll apply statistical models to analyze TEVV results, identify improvements, and develop corrective actions.
Identify and prioritize AI system improvements, implement updates, and conduct technical assessments to ensure compliant use of AI systems for approved use-cases. You'll also develop and maintain a repository of audit findings and recommendations.
Serve as the primary point of contact for development expertise, streamlining repetitive processes, integrating disparate datasets, and maintaining internal tools for analytic production. You'll advise on advancing DIA's analytic edge by creating minimum viable products (MVPs) that standardize and export tradecraft, documenting MVPs for enterprise scaling.
Work with increasingly large and complex data, standing up distributed clusters for advanced analytics. You'll create algorithms to clean, process, analyze, and visualize data. Proficiency in Python, HTML, SQL, JavaScript, and maintaining source code using Git in government-owned/controlled source version control repositories is essential.
Create, edit, and disseminate capability update briefs, collaborate with other vendors and developers, and research/design technical solutions for automation, machine augmentation, and tradecraft compliance. You'll deliver technical capabilities that enhance analysts' ability to interrogate increasingly large and complex datasets.
Additional duties as assigned or required


What we are looking for


0 years relevant experience with Bachelors in related field; High School Diploma or equivalent and 4 years relevant experience
Clearance: Must possess and maintain a TS/SCI with a current Poly
Experience with Python, HTML, SQL, and JavaScript.
In-depth experience with Git for source code management in a collaborative environment.
Proven ability to apply and implement machine learning and data mining algorithms for predictive analysis, entity recognition, extraction, and summarization.
Experience working with large and complex datasets, including data cleaning, processing, analysis, and visualization.
Experience creating and working with distributed clusters for advanced analytics.
Understanding of data engineering concepts, including data warehousing, data compression, and data protection.
Experience developing and maintaining APIs (e.g., GraphQL) for data access.
Ability to apply mathematical, statistical, and scientific techniques to correlate complex findings and derive intelligence from large volumes of data.
Experience with exploratory analysis and rapid iteration techniques.
Demonstrated ability to design and implement automated or computer-assisted prototypes and software.
Experience in designing technical solutions that deliver automation, machine augmentation, and tradecraft compliance capabilities.
Ability to prepare products that describe and document findings and activities.
Ability to review, evaluate, and provide detailed feedback on technical documentation.
Demonstrates ability to work independently and with minimal oversight.


Bonus points for...


Bachelors with 3 years of experience
Recent applicable experience within the last 2 years
Possess or be able to obtain and maintain DoD 8570 or DoD 8140 compliance certificates/tickets


Physical Requirements

May require working in an office, industrial, shipboard, or laboratory environment. Capable of climbing ladders and tolerating confined spaces and extreme temperature variances.

HII is more than a job - it‚Äôs an opportunity to build a new future. We offer competitive benefits such as best-in-class medical, dental and vision plan choices; wellness resources; employee assistance programs; Savings Plan Options (401(k)); financial planning tools, life insurance; employee discounts; paid holidays and paid time off; tuition reimbursement; as well as early childhood and post-secondary education scholarships. Bonus/other non-recurrent compensation is occasionally offered for qualified positions, and if applicable to this role will be addressed by the recruiter at the screening phase of application.

Why HII

We build the world‚Äôs most powerful, survivable naval ships and defense technology solutions that safeguard our seas, sky, land, space and cyber. Our workforce includes skilled tradespeople; artificial intelligence, machine learning (AI/ML) experts; engineers; technologists; scientists; logistics experts; and business administration professionals.

Recognized as one of America‚Äôs top large company employers, we are a values and ethics driven organization that puts people‚Äôs safety and well-being first. Regardless of your role or where you serve, at HII, you‚Äôll find a supportive and welcoming environment, competitive benefits, and valuable educational and training programs for continual career growth at every stage of your career.

Together we are working to ensure a future where everyone can be free and thrive.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, physical or mental disability, age, or veteran status or any other basis protected by federal, state, or local law.

Do You Need Assistance?

If you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the employment process, please send an e-mail to buildyourcareer@hii-co.com and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information. Reasonable accommodations are considered on a case-by-case basis. Please note that only those inquiries concerning a request for reasonable accommodation will be responded to from this email address. Additionally, you may also call 1-844-849-8463 for assistance. Press #3 for HII Mission Technologies.

If you have questions about this posting, please contact support@lensa.com

Title: Junior Data Scientist - LLM
Description:
Verified Job On Employer Career Site




Job Summary:

Stackline is a retail intelligence and software company that provides tools, data, and services for e-commerce. As a Data Scientist, you will develop and deploy Large Language Models, create Machine Learning pipelines, and collaborate with various teams to analyze and derive insights from extensive datasets.




Responsibilities:

‚Ä¢ Develop, test, and deploy Large Language Models or Large Multimodal Models across multiple company products.

‚Ä¢ Independently create innovative Machine Learning pipelines and collaborate with leadership and stakeholders to test and validate data outputs.

‚Ä¢ Provide prompt and accurate responses to both internal and external inquiries about our datasets and models.

‚Ä¢ Apply technical proficiency to process complex and intricate datasets, establish quality control procedures, and derive actionable insights.

‚Ä¢ Utilize data effectively to extract insights and devise innovative strategies, offering actionable recommendations to stakeholders in data science, engineering, and product teams.

‚Ä¢ Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify new opportunities requiring the application of modern data science and Machine Learning techniques.

‚Ä¢ Design and implement innovative models and experiments using cutting edge analytical, mathematical, and machine learning methods to drive growth in new company domains.

‚Ä¢ Document data sources and processes for data analysis and modeling.




Qualifications:




Required:

‚Ä¢ PhD in Mathematics, Physics, Computer Science, Engineering, or another technical field.

‚Ä¢ 1+ years of direct industry work experience in one or more of the following areas: data science, data analytics or data engineering.

‚Ä¢ 1+ years of experience with Machine Learning, statistics and probability, algorithm development, and data analytics.

‚Ä¢ Hands on experience with Large Language Models (LLMs) or Large Multimodal Models (LMMs).

‚Ä¢ Strong proficiency with programming and querying languages like Python and SQL.

‚Ä¢ Experience deploying solutions at scale after prototyping.

‚Ä¢ Demonstrated experience in Machine Learning tools such as Tensorflow, PyTorch, Spark ML, or related frameworks.

‚Ä¢ Experience with distributed version control (e.g. git).




Preferred:

‚Ä¢ Prior experience with big data technologies such as Hadoop or Spark.

Title: Junior ML Scientist | IS Team (Job Ref.: AICOS_Jobs_2025_14) | Porto, Portugal
HTML:
Job Title: Junior ML Scientist

Job Ref: AICOS_Jobs_2025_14

Job Type: Full-time contract.

Job Location: Porto, Portugal.

Job Description And Responsibilities

Fraunhofer Portugal AICOSis seeking a talented Junior ML Scientist to join our dynamic and multidisciplinary team within the Intelligent Systems group. In this role, you will be at the forefront of technological innovation, working on applied research projects that bridge the gap between cutting-edge research and real-world impact. You will contribute to initiatives that enhance industries, promote social well-being, and improve quality of life.

Your Role

Develop advanced anomaly detection and forecasting modules to analyse financial time series, identify risks and provide strategic insights based on historical data trends.

Your Profile

Academic Qualifications:

  • Master‚Äôs degree or equivalent qualifications in Computer Science, Electrical and Computer Engineering, Data science, Artificial Intelligence or related studies.

Technical Skills

  • Programming proficiency in Python and experience with machine learning frameworks (e.g., Sklearn, TensorFlow, Keras, PyTorch);
  • Interest in creating machine learning models from time series.

Other Skills

  • Excellent English communication skills (technical and general audiences);
  • Capacity to translate research findings into actionable insights for real-world applications.

We Value

  • Familiarity with machine learning for tabular data and time series;
  • Experience or interest in forecasting;
  • Interest in applied research in AI and ML;
  • Ability to work effectively in multidisciplinary and cross-functional teams;
  • Autonomous, dependable, proactive, and a critical-thinking team player.

Why Should You Join Fraunhofer Portugal

  • Innovative Environment: Be part of a people-centric workplace that fosters creativity and out-of-the-box thinking. We encourage the development of new ideas and ensure that every voice is heard;
  • Research with Impact: Engage in projects that sit at the intersection of research and real-world applications, contributing to technology that makes a tangible difference in society;
  • Multidisciplinary Teams: Collaborate with professionals from diverse backgrounds, enhancing your learning and professional growth;
  • Professional Excellence: Work within a culture that upholds professional standards and best practices, promoting continuous improvement and excellence in research;
  • Flexible Work Arrangements: Benefit from flexible working hours and opportunities to work from home, supporting a healthy work-life balance;
  • Comprehensive Benefits: Benefit from a partially funded health insurance plan, and a variety of additional perks;
  • Supportive Culture: Join a team with an excellent spirit, where collaboration, mutual support, and team achievements are celebrated.

Application Process

Applications are permanently open until the ideal candidate is selected. The first evaluation of applications will occur on 28th of July 2025.

The selected candidate is expected to start working in September 2025.

To Apply

Send your application to jobs@fraunhofer.pt including:

  • Curriculum Vitae (mandatory);
  • Motivation Letter;
  • Recommendation Letters (optional but welcome).

Note

The research activities in the scope of this job opportunity are planned to be developed within the framework of the following projects:

  • FIBFlow ‚Äì Financial Intelligent Business Flow, with Notice No. MPr-2023-08-SIID-ID (Projetos em Copromo√ß√£o).

Title: Data Science Analyst
Description:
Who We Are

Metyis is a global and forward-thinking firm operating across a wide range of industries, developing and delivering AI & Data, Digital Commerce, Marketing & Design solutions and Advisory services. At Metyis, our long-term partnership model brings long-lasting impact and growth to our business partners and clients through extensive execution capabilities.

With our team, you can experience a collaborative environment with highly skilled multidisciplinary experts, where everyone has room to build bigger and bolder ideas. Being part of Metyis means you can speak your mind and be creative with your knowledge. Imagine the things you can achieve with a team that encourages you to be the best version of yourself.

We are Metyis. Partners for Impact.

What We Offer


A chance to grow your analytics skills in a supportive, international environment.
Direct exposure to real-world business challenges and data-driven strategy.
Mentorship from experienced data scientists and analysts.
Opportunities to evolve toward more advanced data science roles.
Dynamic and diverse team within one of the leading global fashion brands.
Become part of a fast-growing international and diverse team.



What you will do


Support data-driven decision-making by preparing and analyzing data related to customer behavior, CRM performance, and sales across multiple channels.
Work closely with data scientists and business stakeholders to translate business questions into meaningful insights.
Perform exploratory data analysis (EDA) to support data science model development.
Use Python and SQL to clean, process, and visualize data in support of analytics and modeling projects.
Apply basic statistical methods (e.g. descriptive statistics, correlation analysis, hypothesis testing) to uncover insights.
Ensure data quality and consistency across sources by collaborating with data engineering and IT teams.
Communicate findings clearly through presentations and storytelling.
Actively participate in sprint planning, reviews, and agile ceremonies within the team.



What you‚Äôll bring


1‚Äì2 years of experience in analytics, business intelligence, or a related data role (internships included).
Bachelor‚Äôs or master‚Äôs degree in a quantitative field such as Statistics, Economics, Business Analytics, or Engineering.
Experience working with data using SQL and Python (pandas, matplotlib/seaborn).
Experience with PySpark and Spark technologies is a strong plus, but not mandatory.
Basic understanding of statistics and its application in business analytics.
Strong attention to detail, curiosity, and eagerness to learn.
Good communication skills, including the ability to explain data insights to non-technical stakeholders.
Team player with a proactive mindset and willingness to grow in a collaborative environment.
Fluency in English (written and spoken)



Nice to have:


Exposure to cloud platforms like AWS, Azure or Databricks.
Knowledge of Python packages used in machine learning (e.g. scikit-learn).
Participation in academic or personal analytics projects

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Job Purpose




Analyse and interpret US healthcare claims and insurance plan-level data using SQL and Python to assess prescription patterns, patient treatment journey, prescriber landscape, insurance coverage across the competitor landscape, as well as possible unmet need and market size.
Provide strategic insights and inform the commercialization and go-to-market strategy for MoonLake.
Setup and operate analytics infrastructure for MoonLake Commercial across several data sources and platforms.
Drive additional data and insights related cross-functional projects, such as scientific papers.
Conduct detailed analysis using secondary real world data sources, including claims or EHR. Ideally familiar with US private and public drug and medical procedure claims data.
Good knowledge of statistics.
Support development of other study documents including protocols, analysis specifications, and study reports.
Ability to create and characterize patient population, build patient cohorts, and define and validate key variables specific to business questions. Conduct detailed analyses of patient cohorts and QC datasets within time and ensure quality standards for a variety of studies.
Manage and contribute to quality control of programs and automation of data refreshes.
Communicate timelines, progress reports, and results to key stakeholders.
Ability to create dashboards preferred but not essential (PowerBI).




Your profile




Major Accountabilities:




Leverage SQL and Python for efficient data extraction, manipulation, and interpretation for patient claims and plan-level insurance data, e.g.:
Conduct in-depth analysis of patient lifetime treatment journey.
Evaluate healthcare practitioner activity across the market.
Analyse US healthcare claims data to evaluate market presence and trends among competitors.
Analyse healthcare insurance plan-level data to assess prescription market coverage.
Merge and harmonize multiple data sources for advanced analytics.
Identify gaps and opportunities in competitor insurance coverage and market positioning.
Ensure data quality and integrity during analysis to support accurate reporting.
Document all processes, experiments, data sources and analyses to ensure a robust and reproducible infrastructure.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to deliver actionable insights on market trends.
Provide strategic recommendations based on data analysis to inform business decisions.
Create and maintain dashboards or reports to monitor key metrics and market performance, as well as visualize advanced analytics outcomes.




Job Requirements:




Education: Masters in Biomedical Engineering, Biostatistics, Data Science, Computer Science or related field with 2-5 years relevant experience or PhD with 1 years of relevant experience required.

Skills/knowledge/behavioural competencies: SQL, Python, Pandas, SkLearn, NLP, Power BI, Git, Data Visualization.




Qualifications:




Knowledge of statistics, programming, and real-world studies
Prior programming experience using medical health records, RWD or claims data is a bonus.
Intermediate knowledge of SQL, Python or R acceptable.
Good organizational, interpersonal, and communication skills
Ability to effectively manage and prioritize multiple tasks and projects.
Excellent accuracy and attention to detail.




Why us?

An exciting job opportunity awaits you!




MoonLake is a dynamic and innovative company pushing the boundaries of possibility, and we are looking for passionate individuals to join our stellar team.




What we offer:




Learning Environment: An opportunity to learn and grow alongside experienced professionals in a supportive and innovative biotech environment.




Impactful Work: Contribute to ground-breaking projects that have the potential to transform global healthcare.




Flexibility and Balance: Work remotely/hybrid, enjoying a healthy work-life balance while making meaningful contributions to our team.




Career Growth: A clear path for career progression, with the chance to take on more responsibilities as you develop your skills.

Title: Data Scientist (m/f/d)
Description:
Linde Portugal, LDA

Data Scientist (m/f/d)

Porto or Lisboa, Portugal, Barcelona, Spain | req22905

What You Will Enjoy Doing


You will generate value out of data by identification, driving and implementing use cases in the area of analytics across all value streams/ regions/functions
Furthermore, you will provide profound business understanding combined with a strong skillset of advanced data engineering and data science to transform business questions into data driven insight in language such as SQL, R, Python etc
Together with the data science lead drive the concept of data insights and advanced analytics as a key and strategic area in the field of business analytics
You will support in definition and execution of global business analytics strategy, help to position business analytics team as central point of contact for all data analytics questions and use cases
Will be under your responsibility the execution/ management of projects within the area of advanced business analytics closely aligned with business and senior management
Also, you will ensure the Coaching and Training of virtual teams and functional areas within the core disciplines of analytics
You will actively participate in the processes of digitization and automation of tasks, contributing to the company's evolution towards digital transformation


What Makes You Great


You have 5-7 years of experience in analytical insights and data science and hold a master‚Äôs degree in STEM from a prestigious university
Also, you have a natural ability to turn concepts into computational systems and transform business questions into data-driven insights
In addition, you have strong expertise in Finance, Sales, and Supply Chain processes
You are an expert in data modeling, feature engineering, and have strong knowledge of SQL, R, R Shiny, and Python
Furthermore, you have a solid understanding of data and system architectures and their role in digital transformation
You possess excellent English communication skills and can effectively engage with technical and business teams
Also, you have experience in Scrum and Agile methodologies to manage projects and drive high-performing teams
Additionally you are willing to travel when necessary to support business initiatives
You are ready to face new challenges and actively contribute to the success of the company's digital transformation project
You are able to collect, interpret and use data effectively, driving digital transformation


Why you will love working with us

At Linde we identify ourselves with our products ‚Äì either working for the technical or medical gases business. Being a company with a long tradition in the gases business, we not only care about our customers and high quality products, but most importantly about our employees. While working with us, expect a safe workplace, high safety standards and a true commitment from our managers to safety.

What we offer you!

At Linde, the sky is not the limit. If you‚Äôre looking to build a career where your work reaches beyond your job description and betters the people with whom you work, the communities we serve, and the world in which we all live, at Linde, your opportunities are limitless. Be Linde. Be Limitless.

This role is a full time position based on an unlimited contract. The standard weekly working hours will be from 08:00 hrs till 17:00 hrs.

Have we inspired you? Let¬¥s talk about it

We are looking forward to receiving your complete application (motivation letter, CV, certificates) via our online job market.

Any designations used of course apply to persons of all genders. The form of speech used here is for simplicity only.

Linde acts responsibly towards its shareholders, business partners, employees, society and the environment in every one of its business areas, regions and locations across the globe. The company is committed to technologies and products that unite the goals of customer value and sustainable development.
